item.title: Webclient Tutorial [317 - 637]
item.dc:creator: @mickie456 mickie456
item.description:
@mickie456 wrote:

[quote=“Sparkslasher, post:50, topic:432659”]When I try to run the webclient, the Java screen appears, then a white screen comes up and a small message in the corner saying “Error - click for details”.

When I click, I get this:

Java Plug-in 10.3.1.255
Using JRE version 1.7.0_03-b05 Java HotSpot™ Client VM
User home directory = C:\Users\Epic

c: clear console window
f: finalize objects on finalization queue
g: garbage collect
h: display this help message
l: dump classloader list
m: print memory usage
o: trigger logging
q: hide console
r: reload policy configuration
s: dump system and deployment properties
t: dump thread list
v: dump thread stack
x: clear classloader cache
0-5: set trace level to

What am I doing wrong?[/quote]
i think you didn’t make it client.jar, if you have made a custom u need to change the client.jar what is in the HTML code, so u ctrl + f then u search for client.jar and change it to “yourcustomname.jar” hope this helps

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Tutorial [317 - 637]
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

any help is appreciated thanks!
[i]1) I set the output file to where i wanted the client to be .jar’d to.

2)I changed the application.jar to client.jar. at the top right

  1. I set the Input File selection to the first page where my .classes are, its the same page as the run.bat I’m using Project Insanity.

4)I hit the Manifest Template and changed the main class to “client”. And this is the info for my run.bat (aka) how i found the main class “client”

[code]
@echo off
TITLE Client

start javaW -Xmx1000m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32
exit[/code]

  1. I set the manifest, and create the .jar, I get a pop-up window that says it was created successfully

  2. I open the finished client.jar file and i get a blank white screen that i cant close
    [/i]

Read full topic

item.title: Webclient Tutorial [317 - 637]
item.dc:creator: @tobias222 tobias222
item.description:
@tobias222 wrote:

You should really keep CACHENAME the same, as 508+ caches are quite large and there’s no point in downloading two exactly the same just because it’s two different servers.
